His playing style has frequently led to the media, coaches, and colleagues ranking him among the best players in Europe,{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/kevin-de-bruyne-as-good-lionel-messi-cristiano-ronaldo-manchester-city-real-madrid-barcelona-a8045706.html |title=Kevin de Bruyne can become as good as Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo, says Roberto Martinez |publisher=The Independent |first=Luke |last=Brown |date=9 November 2017 |access-date=16 November 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.squawka.com/news/pep-guardiola-calls-kevin-de-bruyne-the-best-player-in-europe-bar-one/999940|title=Pep Guardiola calls Kevin De Bruyne "the best player in Europe bar one" |publisher=Squawka |first=Cady |last=Siregar |date=16 October 2017 |access-date=16 November 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/manchester-city/story/3264836/kevin-de-bruyne-best-player-in-the-premier-league-at-the-moment-eden-hazard|title=Kevin De Bruyne best player in Premier League at the moment – Eden Hazard |date=10 November 2017 |website=ESPN FC |first=Ian |last=Holyman |access-date=16 November 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41623610 |title=Hughes praises 'best |date=15 January 2018 |access-date=8 July 2018}} and has often been described as a "complete" footballer.{{cite web |title=Pep Guardiola and Antonio Conte laud Kevin De Bruyne for being the perfect 'complete' player after masterclass |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/chelsea-vs-manchester-city-kevin-de-bruyne-perfect-complete-guardiola-conte-reaction-a7976051.html |work=The Independent |first=Miguel |last=Delaney |date=30 September 2017 |access-date=8 July 2018}}{{cite web |title=Where would Manchester City be without Kevin De Bruyne, the most complete player in the Premier League? |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/chelsea-vs-manchester-city-kevin-de-bruyne-goals-highlights-most-complete-player-premier-league-a7976031.html |work=The Independent |first=Jack |last=Pitt-Brooke |date=30 September 2017 |access-date=7 July 2018}} He was ranked the fourth-best footballer in the world by ''[[The Guardian]]'' in 2017.{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/ng-interactive/2017/dec/19/the-100-best-footballers-in-the-world-2017-interactive |title=The 100 best footballers in the world 2017 |date=19 December 2017 |work=[[The Guardian]] |access-date=24 December 2017}} De Bruyne began his career at [[K.R.C. Genk|Genk]], where he was a regular player when they won the [[2010–11 Belgian Pro League]]. In 2012, he joined English club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], where he was used sparingly and then loaned to [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]]. He signed with [[VfL Wolfsburg|Wolfsburg]] for £18 million in 2014, and in 2015 he was named [[Footballer of the Year in Germany]].{{cite web|url=http://sporza.be/cm/sporza/voetbal/buitenland/Duitsland/1.2400701 |title=De Bruyne is Speler van het Jaar volgens Duitse Journalisten |language=nl |date=26 July 2015 |accessdate=26 July 2015 |work=[[Sporza]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160716195857/http://sporza.be/cm/sporza/voetbal/buitenland/Duitsland/1.2400701 |archivedate=16 July 2016 |df= }} Later that year, he joined Manchester City for a club record £54 million. In three seasons with City, De Bruyne has appeared in over 140 matches and won a [[Premier League]] title and two [[EFL Cup|League Cups]]. He had a significant role in City's quest to become the first Premier League team to [[Premier League records and statistics#Points|attain 100 points]] in a single season in the [[2017–18 Premier League|2017–18]]. Additionally, De Bruyne has been named [[Manchester City#Player of the Year|Manchester City's Player of the Year]], twice, in [[2015–16 Manchester City F.C. season|2016]] and [[2017–18 Manchester City F.C. season|2018]]. De Bruyne made his full international debut in 2010, and has since earned over 65 [[Caps (football)|caps]] and scored 15 goals for Belgium. He was a member of the Belgian squads that reached the quarter-finals both at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and at [[UEFA Euro 2016]]. In 2018 he represented Belgium at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|FIFA World Cup]], winning the [[2018 FIFA World Cup#Third place play-off|third place play-off]] match against [[England national football team|England]]. ==Club career== ===Genk=== De Bruyne began his career with hometown club KVV Drongen in 2003. Two years later, he joined [[K.A.A. Gent|Gent]] and moved to [[K.R.C. Genk|Genk]] in 2005. De Bruyne continued his development in their youth set-up and was rewarded for his progress by being promoted to the first team squad in 2008. De Bruyne made his first team debut for [[K.R.C. Genk|Genk]] in a 3–0 defeat at [[S. du Pays de Charleroi|Charleroi]] on 9 May 2009.{{cite news|title=Charleroi 3–0 Genk|url=http://guardian.touch-line.com/?Lang=0&mTEID=1175&Season=2008%20-%202009&CTID=6&CPID=10&TEID=1175&RFID=&PLID=213148&MAID=408547&ListType=8&pStr=Match_Details&t=2|accessdate=27 May 2011|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121011114010/http://guardian.touch-line.com/?Lang=0&mTEID=1175&Season=2008%20-%202009&CTID=6&CPID=10&TEID=1175&RFID=&PLID=213148&MAID=408547&ListType=8&pStr=Match_Details&t=2|archivedate=11 October 2012}} Having established himself in the team [[2009–10 Belgian Pro League|the following season]],{{NFT player|id=39513|name=Kevin De Bruyne|access-date=27 May 2011}} on 7 February 2010, De Bruyne scored his first goal for the club, which secured all three points for Genk in a 1–0 win against [[Standard Liège]].{{cite news|title=Genk 1–0 Standard Liege|url=http://guardian.touch-line.com/?Lang=0&mTEID=1175&Season=2009%20-%202010&CTID=6&CPID=10&TEID=1175&RFID=&PLID=213148&MAID=419917&ListType=9&pStr=Match_Details&t=3|accessdate=27 May October 2012}} He scored five goals and made 16 assists in 32 league matches during the 2010–11 season as Genk were crowned [[Belgian Pro League|Belgian]] champions for the third time.{{cite web|title=Genk clinch third Belgian title with Liege draw|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2011/05/17/uk-soccer-belgium-champions-idUKTRE74G7D120110517|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=27 May 2011|date=17 May 2011}} On 29 October 2011, De Bruyne scored his first hat-trick for Genk against [[Club Brugge K.V.|Club Brugge]], which ended in a 5–4 win for Genk.{{cite web|title=Kevin De Bruyne (3) stars as Genk win 5–4 at Club Brugge|url=http://www.101greatgoals.com/goals/europe/kevin-de-bruyne-3-stars-as-genk-win-5-4-at-club-brugge/}} On 28 January 2012, De Bruyne scored a brace against [[Oud-Heverlee Leuven|OH Leuven]] in a 5–0 win. On 18 February 2012, De Bruyne scored his first goal back at Genk following his agreed transfer to [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] and also assisted the other goal in a 1–2 away win against [[R.A.E.C. Mons|Mons]]. De Bruyne ended the season by wrapping up the scoring in a 3–1 victory over [[K.A.A. Gent|Gent]]. He finished the league campaign with eight goals from 28 appearances. ===Chelsea=== [[File:Kevin De Bruyne Chelsea vs AS-Roma 10AUG2013.jpg|thumb|right|100px|De Bruyne warming up with Chelsea in 2013]] On 31 January 2012, on the winter transfer deadline day, [[Premier League]] club Chelsea and Genk announced the permanent signing of De Bruyne, with the fee rumoured to be in the region of £7 million.{{cite news| title = Genk confirm De Bruyne sale| url =http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11095/7467271/Genk-confirm-De-Bruyne-sale | publisher = Sky Sport| date = 31 January 2012| accessdate = 31 January 2012 | first = Graeme | last = Bailey}} He signed a five-and-a-half-year contract at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]], but would stay at Genk for the remainder of the 2011–12 season. De Bruyne told the club website, "To come to a team like Chelsea is a dream but now I have to work hard to achieve the level that's necessary."{{cite news|title=Kevin becomes a blue |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2594667 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130425091338/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2594667 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=25 April 2013 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=31 January 2012 |accessdate=7 July 2014 }}{{cite news| title = Chelsea sign Kevin De Bruyne from Genk| url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/16721393.stm | publisher = BBC Sport| date = 31 January 2012| accessdate = 31 January 2012}} On 18 July 2012, De Bruyne made his debut for Chelsea in a friendly match against [[Major League Soccer]] (MLS) side [[Seattle Sounders FC]] in a 4–2 win. De Bruyne also played the first half against [[Ligue 1]] giants [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] at [[Yankee Stadium]], [[New York City|New York]]. ====Werder Bremen (loan)==== [[File:Kevin de bruyne werder.JPG|thumb|left|175px|De Bruyne during his spell with Werder Bremen in 2012]] On 2 August 2012, Chelsea announced that De Bruyne was to join [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] in the [[Bundesliga]] on a season-long loan deal after having successfully completed a medical.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2182639/Kevin-Bruyne-joins-Werder-Bremen-season-long-loan.html|title=Chelsea send £7m youngster De Bruyne to Werder Bremen on season-long loan|work=Daily Mail}} De Bruyne scored his first goal for Bremen in a 3–2 defeat to [[Hannover 96]] on 15 September, netting from 11 yards out after being played in by [[Eljero Elia]].{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/346384/gamecast.html |title=Hannover 96 3–2 Werder Bremen |publisher=ESPN FC |date=15 September 2012| accessdate = 7 July 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/264956/report|title=Huszti is hero and villain|publisher=Sky Sports|date=15 September 2012|accessdate=7 July 2014}} De Bruyne continued his good form, scoring in Bremen's next game, a 2–2 draw with [[VfB Stuttgart]], on 23 September.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/346376/gamecast.html |title=Werder Bremen 2–2 VfB Stuttgart |publisher=ESPN FC |date=23 September 2012 | accessdate = 7 July 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/267321/report|title=Honours even at Weser Stadion|publisher=Sky Sports|date=23 September 2012|accessdate=7 July 2014}} De Bruyne got back on the score sheet on 18 November, scoring the winning goal — despite his team being down to 10 men — as Bremen came from a goal down to defeat [[Fortuna Düsseldorf]] 2–1.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/346299/gamecast.html |title= Werder Bremen 2–1 Fortuna Düsseldorf |publisher=ESPN FC |date=18 November 2012 | accessdate = 7 July 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/279413/report|title=Winning start for Schaaf|publisher=Sky Sports|date=19 November 2012|accessdate=7 July 2014}} De Bruyne scored his first goal in over two months on 4 May 2013, since netting a consolation goal in [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]]'s 6–1 hammering of Bremen, putting his side up 2–0 at home to [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim]] before a late brace from [[Sven Schipplock]] meant that the game finished 2–2.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/346123/gamecast.html |title=Werder Bremen 2–2 TSG Hoffenheim |publisher=ESPNFC |date=4 May 2013}}{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/265457/report|title=Hoffenheim fight back to draw|publisher=Sky Sports|date=4 May 2013|accessdate=7 July 2014}} He followed this up with a goal in Bremen's next match, securing a place in the Bundesliga for the next season with a 1–1 draw against [[Eintracht Frankfurt]] on 11 May.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/gamecast/346110/gamecast.htm |title=Werder Bremen 1–1 Eintracht Frankfurt |publisher=ESPNFC |date=11 May 2013 }}{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/265466/report|title=Eagles secure a point|publisher=Sky Sports|date=11 May 2013|accessdate=7 July 2014}} ====Return to Chelsea==== After a successful loan spell in the Bundesliga with Werder Bremen, De Bruyne was linked with a move to stay in Germany with either [[Borussia Dortmund]] or [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]]. Incoming manager [[José Mourinho]], however, assured De Bruyne he was a part of Chelsea's plan for the future, and the player officially returned to Chelsea on 1 July 2013.{{cite web|title=De Bruyne to fight for Chelsea place| url=http://espnfc.com/news/story/_/id/1481782/de-bruyne-fight-chelsea-place?cc=5901|publisher=ESPNFC|date=21 June 2013}} De Bruyne injured a knee while scoring his first goal for Chelsea, in a pre-season friendly game against a Malaysia XI,{{cite news |title=Chelsea: Kevin De Bruyne set for scan on knee injury |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23400115 |first=Richard |last=Conway |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 July 2013 |accessdate=3 September 2014}} but was fit to make his competitive debut on the opening day of the [[2013–14 Premier League]] season against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]], and made an assist for the first goal in a 2–0 win.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/aug/18/chelsea-hull-city-premier-league |title=José Mourinho enjoys stylish return as Chelsea cruise against Hull |first=Daniel |last=Taylor |newspaper=The Guardian |date=18 August 2013 |accessdate=3 September 2014}} ===Wolfsburg=== ====2013–14 season==== On 18 January 2014, [[VfL Wolfsburg|Wolfsburg]] signed De Bruyne for a fee of £18 million (€22 million).{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/jan/18/chelsea-sell-kevin-de-bruyne-wolfsburg |title=Chelsea sell Kevin De Bruyne to Wolfsburg |work=[[The Guardian]] |date=18 January 2014 |accessdate=18 January 2014}} On 25 January 2014, he made his debut for Wolfsburg in a 3–1 home loss against [[Hannover 96]].{{cite web|url=http://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/wolfsburg/team-news/team-news-de-bruyne-straight-in-for-wolfsburg_132637.html |title=Team News: Kevin de Bruyne straight in for Wolfsburg |work=Sports Mole |date=25 January 2014 |accessdate=7 July 2014}} On 12 April 2014, De Bruyne assisted 2 goals in their 4–1 home win against [[1. FC Nürnberg]].{{cite web|url=http://www.whoscored.com/Matches/724028/Live/Germany-Bundesliga-2013-2014-Wolfsburg-Nurnberg |title=Wolfsburg-Nurnberg Live |work=Whoscored.com |date= |accessdate=7 July 2014}} After a week he scored his first goal for Wolfsburg in 3–1 away win against [[Hamburger SV]].{{cite web|url=http://www.bundesliga.com/en/liga/news/2013/0000291918.php |title=De Bruyne: 'We want nine points' | VfL Wolfsburg | Matchday 31 | Reaction – Bundesliga – official website |publisher=Bundesliga |date=20 April 2014 |accessdate=7 July 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140422233138/http://www.bundesliga.com/en/liga/news/2013/0000291918.php |archivedate=22 April 2014 |df= }} He also scored in the last two matches of the [[2013–14 Bundesliga|Bundesliga]] helping his team to win against [[VfB Stuttgart]] and [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]]. ====2014–15 season==== [[File:Emirates Cup - Arsenal v Wolfsburg (20011199918).jpg|thumbnail|De Bruyne playing for Wolfsburg against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in July 2015]] De Bruyne scored his first goal of the [[2014–15 VfL Wolfsburg season|2014–15 season]] on 2 October 2014, volleying in a clearance from outside the box to salvage a 1–1 draw against [[LOSC Lille Métropole|Lille]] in the [[2014-15 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]].{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000587/match=2014469/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Wolfsburg rally to peg back LOSC |work=UEFA |date=2 October 2014 |accessdate=3 October 2014 }} In the third group match away to [[FC Krasnodar|Krasnodar]] on 23 October, De Bruyne scored twice as Wolfsburg secured their first win in the competition with a 4–2 victory.{{cite web |url=http://www.bundesliga.com/en/el/news/2014/0000305024.php |title=De Bruyne Double Fires Wolfsburg to First European Win |work=Bundesliga |date=23 October 2014 |accessdate=23 October 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141101165628/http://www.bundesliga.com/en/el/news/2014/0000305024.php |archivedate=1 November 2014 }} On 30 January 2015, he scored another brace in a 4–1 home win against Bayern Munich, their first Bundesliga defeat since April 2014.{{cite news|last1=Begley|first1=Emlyn|title= VfL Wolfsburg 4–1 Bayern Munich|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30991047|accessdate=17 March 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=30 January 2015}} On 1 March 2015, De Bruyne assisted three goals in a 5–3 win over his former club Werder Bremen.{{cite web|url = http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/match/540771.html|title = Werder Bremen 3–5 VfL Wolfsburg|date = 1 March 2015|accessdate = 17 March 2015|work = ESPN (UK)|last = |first = }} On 12 March 2015, De Bruyne scored two goals in a 3–1 first-leg Europa League round-of-16 victory over [[F.C. Internazionale Milano|Internazionale]].{{cite web|url = http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2015/matches/round=2000589/match=2014610/postmatch/report/index.html#de+bruyne+unpicks+inter|title = De Bruyne-powered Wolfsburg snap back at Inter|date = 12 March 2015|accessdate = 15 March 2015|website = UEFA.COM|publisher =UEFA |last = |first = }} On 15 March 2015, he scored one goal and assisted another two in 3–0 victory over [[SC Freiburg]].{{cite news|url = https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/31875612|title = VfL Wolfsburg 3–0 Sport-Club Freiburg|date = 15 March 2015|accessdate = 17 March 2015|work = BBC Sport}} De Bruyne ended the league season with 10 goals and 21 assists, the latter a new [[Bundesliga records#Assists|Bundesliga record]], as Wolfsburg finished second in the [[2014–15 Bundesliga|Bundesliga]] and qualified for the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League]].{{cite news|url=http://www.rtbf.be/sport/football/etranger/allemagne/detail_de-bruyne-entre-dans-l-histoire-de-la-bundesliga?id=8982166|title=De Bruyne entre dans l'histoire de la Bundesliga|language=French|date=16 May 2015|work=RTBF Sport}} On 30 May 2015, he started and scored in the [[2015 DFB-Pokal Final]] as ''Die Wölfe'' defeated [[Borussia Dortmund]] 3–1 at the [[Olympiastadion (Berlin)|Olympiastadion]] in [[Berlin]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/32938029|title=Borussia Dortmd 1–3 VfL Wolfsburg|date=30 May 2015|work=BBC Sport}} De Bruyne ended his breakout season with 16 goals and 27 assists in all competitions,{{cite web|title='Kevin De Bruyne is off to Man City' says Wolfsburg director Klaus Allofs|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2585622/kevin-de-bruyne-is-off-to-manchester-city-says-wolfsburg|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|accessdate=28 August 2015|date=28 August 2015}} and was named the 2015 [[Footballer of the Year in Germany]]. ====2015–16 season==== De Bruyne began the season by winning the [[2015 DFL-Supercup]] against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]], providing the cross for [[Nicklas Bendtner]]'s 89th-minute equaliser for a 1–1 draw and then scoring in the subsequent [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]].{{cite news|last1=Dunbar|first1=Ross|title=Bendtner leads Wolfsburg over Bayern Munich on penalties in German Super Cup clash|url=http://www.foxsports.com/soccer/story/bendtner-leads-wolfsburg-over-bayern-munich-on-penalties-in-german-super-cup-clash-080115?vid=null|accessdate=3 August 2015|publisher=Fox Sports|date=1 August 2015}} On 8 August 2015, he continued his good form by scoring his first goal of the season, and providing two assists in a 4–1 win at [[Stuttgarter Kickers]] in the first round of the [[2015–16 DFB-Pokal|DFB-Pokal]].{{cite web|title=De Bruynes artwork rewarded wide awake Wolves|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/dfbpokal/spielrunde/dfb-pokal/2015-16/1/2841065/spielbericht_stuttgarter-kickers-26_vfl-wolfsburg-24.html|publisher=Kicker|accessdate=10 August 2015|date=8 August 2015}} In August, De Bruyne, in the midst of transfer speculation, insisted that he would not force Wolfsburg to sell him, but admitted that he could not ignore interest from [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], saying: "If an offer does come, I will hear about it and how much it is, but I have not yet heard anything... I would not go to England just to prove that I can play there. I do not have to go to England... If I go there it’s because for me and for my family it is a good choice. That’s the key for me."{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/2892/transfer-zone/2015/08/03/14113752/de-bruyne-i-will-not-force-wolfsburg-to-sell-me |title=Manchester City transfer news: Kevin De Bruyne: I will not force Wolfsburg to sell me |publisher=Goal.com |date=3 August 2015 |accessdate=10 August 2015}} On 10 August, it was reported that Manchester City had made a second bid for De Bruyne worth £47 million.
